alert.note: Alert for Northern Dona Ana County; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS El Paso (Southern New Mexico and extreme Western Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 16 at 4:21PM MDT by NWS El Paso
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Dona Ana County through 445 PM MDT... At 421 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Fairacres, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leasburg, Las Cruces, White Sands Missile Range Headquarters, NMSU Main Campus, Dona Ana, Mesilla, Fairacres, Organ, Talavera, East Mesa, San Pablo, Picacho, Portions of Jornada Experimental Range, Hill, Northeast Las Cruces, Corralitos, Dripping Springs, Aguirre Springs, Mesilla Valley Bosque State Park and Portions of Organ Mountains Desert Peaks National Monument. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 in New Mexico between mile markers 125 and 148. Interstate 25 in New Mexico between mile markers 1 and 17. Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 150 and 169. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Northern Dona Ana County; Southern Dona Ana County, Mesilla Valley; Southern Tularosa Basin
